content.raw:
Error case:

1) Enable PROFILE building mode
2) I don't have google heap-checker installed
3) run make. Compilation will fail with:

    In file included from /home/nkoenig/work/gazebo/gazebo/common/Event.hh:21:0,
                     from /home/nkoenig/work/gazebo/gazebo/common/Events.hh:21,
                     from /home/nkoenig/work/gazebo/gazebo/common/Diagnostics.cc:22:
    /home/nkoenig/work/gazebo/build/gazebo/gazebo_config.h:29:33: fatal error: google/heap-checker.h: No such file or directory
    compilation terminated.
    make[2]: *** [gazebo/common/CMakeFiles/gazebo_common.dir/Diagnostics.cc.o] Error

Should cmake return an error if PROFILE is enabled, but the google perftools are not installed?

I had to install `libgoogle-perftools-dev`
content.html:
Error case:

1) Enable PROFILE building mode 2) I don't have google heap-checker installed 3) run make. Compilation will fail with:

In file included from /home/nkoenig/work/gazebo/gazebo/common/Event.hh:21:0,
                 from /home/nkoenig/work/gazebo/gazebo/common/Events.hh:21,
                 from /home/nkoenig/work/gazebo/gazebo/common/Diagnostics.cc:22:
/home/nkoenig/work/gazebo/build/gazebo/gazebo_config.h:29:33: fatal error: google/heap-checker.h: No such file or directory
compilation terminated.
make[2]: *** [gazebo/common/CMakeFiles/gazebo_common.dir/Diagnostics.cc.o] Error

Should cmake return an error if PROFILE is enabled, but the google perftools are not installed?

I had to install libgoogle-perftools-dev

content.raw:
It should, indeed. 

That was probably because you used ```CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Profile``` and not ```CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=PROFILE``` (uppercase). We handle this in the main CMakeLists.txt but that is done **after** we include the SearchForStuff module. I have replicate the same hack for this and update the pull request. Should work now but I probably will give a higher priority to issue #279 and fix the whole problem.
content.html:
It should, indeed.

That was probably because you used CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Profile and not CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=PROFILE (uppercase). We handle this in the main CMakeLists.txt but that is done after we include the SearchForStuff module. I have replicate the same hack for this and update the pull request. Should work now but I probably will give a higher priority to issue #279 and fix the whole problem.

content.raw:
The pull request only tried to solve the compilation problem, sorry I didn't test the profile system which probably will take a bit more of time to check if results are correct.

Nate, Claude Lacoursière provided [more information about using the profiler](http://kforge.ros.org/pipermail/gazebo-list/2013-January/004395.html) which I think should be our starting point. 

I will add profile support to my TODO list so we can give it the proper priority.
content.html:
The pull request only tried to solve the compilation problem, sorry I didn't test the profile system which probably will take a bit more of time to check if results are correct.

Nate, Claude Lacoursière provided more information about using the profiler which I think should be our starting point.

I will add profile support to my TODO list so we can give it the proper priority.
